meanings.definition: Abnormal red pigmentation in an animal
meanings.sent1: The erythrism in the bird's feathers made it stand out from the others.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the erythrism in the fish to understand its genetic cause.
meanings.sent3: The zoo visitors were amazed by the erythrism in the monkey's fur, joking that it must have eaten too many tomatoes.
meanings.sent4: The erythrism in the sunset painted the sky a vibrant shade of red.
meanings.sent5: The erythrism in the flower petals was so intense that it almost seemed unreal.

meanings.definition: A condition of being red or reddish in color
meanings.sent1: The erythrism of the autumn leaves signaled the arrival of the new season.
meanings.sent2: Her cheeks flushed with erythrism when she was embarrassed.
meanings.sent3: The artist used erythrism in the painting to create a warm and inviting atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The erythrism of the ripe strawberries made them irresistible to pick.
meanings.sent5: The erythrism of the barn gave it a rustic and charming appearance.
